oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-08-04 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 4, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Webb Pierce (host/performer), guest performers the Louvin Brothers (although Hawkshaw Hawkins was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Webb Pierce; Rod Brasfield; Louvin Brothers; Del Wood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Webb Pierce -- Any Old Time (Webb Pierce) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Webb Pierce) -- Webb Pierce introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Webb Pierce) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Webb Pierce) -- Webb Pierce introduces the Louvin Brothers -- Hoping That You're Hoping (Louvin Brothers) -- Webb Pierce talks -- Soldier's Joy -- Webb Pierce talks -- Mother Call My Name In Prayer (Webb Pierce) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Webb Pierce) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Webb Pierce introduces Del Wood -- Rocky Mountain Express (Del Wood) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Wood, Del; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Louvin Brothers; Louvin, Ira, 1924-1965; Louvin, Charlie, 1927-2011; Pierce, Webb, 1921-1991; Face in the crowd (Motion picture)
